title: Fix positional argument order: use angle brackets for both args
description:
Previous fix (using .positional() builder) didn't fully resolve argument order issue.

## Root Cause
Using `[optional] <required>` syntax causes yargs to parse arguments in wrong order.

## Actual Fix
Change from square brackets to angle brackets for both positional args:
- Before: `comment [prIdOrUrl] <comment>`
- After: `comment <prIdOrUrl> <comment>`

This ensures yargs parses them left-to-right as expected.

## Commands to fix
- pr-comment.ts - Already using .positional() but needs angle brackets
- pr-reply.ts - User fixed this one, use as reference
- Any other commands with optional positional args

## Note
This changes the API slightly - prIdOrUrl becomes required positionally, but auto-detection still works when omitting it entirely.

title: Convert prIdOrUrl from positional to --pr option
description:
The positional argument order issue with yargs is better solved by converting prIdOrUrl to an option.

## Problem
- `[optional] <required>` causes wrong parsing order
- Making both required (`<prIdOrUrl> <comment>`) breaks auto-detect functionality

## Solution
Convert prIdOrUrl to a named option `--pr`:

### New API
```bash
# Comment
aide ado comment <comment> [--pr <id|url>]
aide ado comment "LGTM!"                    # auto-detect PR
aide ado comment "LGTM!" --pr 28550         # explicit PR ID
aide ado comment "LGTM!" --pr https://...   # explicit PR URL

# Reply  
aide ado reply <replyText> --thread <id> [--pr <id|url>]
aide ado reply "Thanks!" --thread 123       # auto-detect PR
aide ado reply "Thanks!" --thread 123 --pr 28550
```

## Files to modify
- src/cli/commands/ado/pr-comment.ts
- src/cli/commands/ado/pr-reply.ts
- commands/pr-comment.md (update docs)
- commands/pr-reply.md (update docs)

description:
## Summary
Add a new command `aide ado pr create` to create pull requests via the Azure DevOps REST API.

## API Research

**Endpoint:** `POST https://dev.azure.com/{org}/{project}/_apis/git/repositories/{repo}/pullrequests?api-version=7.1`

**Required fields:**
- `sourceRefName` - Source branch (e.g., `refs/heads/feature-branch`)
- `targetRefName` - Target branch (e.g., `refs/heads/main`)
- `title` - PR title
- `description` - PR description

**Optional fields:**
- `isDraft` (boolean) - Create as draft PR
- `reviewers` (array) - List of reviewer IDs
- `workItemRefs` - Link to work items

**Auth scope:** `vso.code_write`

## Proposed CLI Interface

```bash
# Basic usage (auto-detect source branch from current git branch)
aide ado pr create --title "My PR" --target main

# Full options
aide ado pr create   --title "My PR"   --description "Description here"   --source feature-branch   --target main   --draft   --format json
```

## Implementation Notes

1. Add POST method to `AzureDevOpsClient`
2. Auto-detect source branch from `git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD`
3. Auto-prefix branch names with `refs/heads/` if not present
4. Return PR URL on success

## References
- [PR Create API Docs](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/git/pull-requests/create?view=azure-devops-rest-7.1)

title: Fix positional argument order in aide ado comment/reply commands
description:
Agent report: Positional arguments are parsed in wrong order for comment and reply commands.

## Issues Found

### 1. aide ado comment - Argument Order Mismatch
- **Expected** (per help): `aide ado comment [prIdOrUrl] <comment>`
- **Actual working**: `aide ado comment "comment text" <prIdOrUrl>`
- **Symptom**: Running `aide ado comment 28550 "Test comment"` uses PR ID as comment content, resulting in comment that just says "28550"

### 2. aide ado reply - Same Issue
- **Expected**: `aide ado reply <pr-id> --thread <thread-id> "reply text"`
- **Actual working**: `aide ado reply "reply text" <pr-id> --thread <thread-id>`
- **Error**: "Could not parse 'Test reply' as a PR ID" when using documented order

### 3. --comment flag silently ignored
- Running `aide ado comment 28550 --comment "Test comment"` silently ignores --comment flag and uses PR ID as comment text

## Root Cause Hypothesis
The yargs positional argument parser is consuming arguments in wrong order - treating first positional as comment text and second as PR ID, opposite of documentation.

## Files to investigate
- src/cli/commands/ado/pr-comment.ts
- src/cli/commands/ado/pr-reply.ts
close_reason: Fixed by using yargs .positional() builder function instead of object syntax

title: Add ado pr reply command to reply to PR comment threads
description:
## Summary
Add a new command `aide ado pr reply` to reply to existing comment threads on pull requests.

## API Research

**Endpoint:** `POST https://dev.azure.com/{org}/{project}/_apis/git/repositories/{repo}/pullRequests/{prId}/threads/{threadId}/comments?api-version=7.1`

**Request body:**
```json
{
  "content": "Reply text",
  "parentCommentId": 1,
  "commentType": 1
}
```

**Key points:**
- `parentCommentId` - ID of the comment being replied to (use 0 or omit for root-level in thread)
- Up to 500 comments can be created per thread
- Comment IDs start at 1 and are unique per PR

**Auth scopes:** `vso.code_write` or `vso.threads_full`

## Proposed CLI Interface

```bash
# Reply to a thread (thread ID from `ado comments` output)
aide ado pr reply 123 --thread 456 "Thanks, I'll fix that"

# Reply to a specific comment in thread
aide ado pr reply 123 --thread 456 --parent 2 "Good point"

# Read reply from stdin
echo "Detailed response..." | aide ado pr reply 123 --thread 456 --stdin
```

## Implementation Notes

1. Add comment creation method to `AzureDevOpsClient`
2. Thread ID is required; can be obtained from `ado comments` output
3. Consider adding `--resolve` flag to resolve thread after replying
4. Parent comment ID is optional (defaults to replying to thread, not specific comment)

## Related

This feature works well with the existing `ado comments` command which shows thread IDs.

## References
- [PR Thread Comments Create API](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/git/pull-request-thread-comments/create?view=azure-devops-rest-7.1)

description:
## Summary
Add a new command `aide ado pr update` to update existing pull requests (title, description, draft status, etc.)

## API Research

**Endpoint:** `PATCH https://dev.azure.com/{org}/{project}/_apis/git/repositories/{repo}/pullrequests/{prId}?api-version=7.1`

**Updatable properties:**
- `title` - PR title
- `description` - PR description (max 4000 chars)
- `status` - `active`, `abandoned`, `completed`
- `isDraft` - Set to `false` to publish a draft PR
- `targetRefName` - Retarget to different branch
- `autoCompleteSetBy.id` - Enable auto-complete
- `completionOptions` - Merge strategy, delete source branch, etc.

**Auth scope:** `vso.code_write`

## Proposed CLI Interface

```bash
# Update title/description
aide ado pr update 123 --title "New title" --description "Updated desc"

# Publish a draft PR
aide ado pr update 123 --publish

# Mark as draft
aide ado pr update 123 --draft

# Abandon PR
aide ado pr update 123 --abandon

# Set merge options
aide ado pr update 123 --squash --delete-branch
```

## Implementation Notes

1. Add PATCH method to `AzureDevOpsClient`
2. Support partial updates (only send changed fields)
3. Add convenience flags like `--publish` that set `isDraft: false`

## References
- [PR Update API Docs](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/git/pull-requests/update?view=azure-devops-rest-7.1)

```json
    "commentType": 1
  }],
  "status": 1,
  "threadContext": {
    "filePath": "/path/to/file.ts",
    "rightFileStart": { "line": 5, "offset": 1 },
    "rightFileEnd": { "line": 5, "offset": 13 }
  }
}
```

**Thread status values:**
- 1 = active
- 2 = fixed
- 3 = wontFix
- 4 = closed
- 5 = byDesign
- 6 = pending

**Auth scopes:** `vso.code_write` or `vso.threads_full`

## Proposed CLI Interface

```bash
# General PR comment
aide ado pr comment 123 "This looks good!"

# Comment on specific file/line
aide ado pr comment 123 "Consider using const here"   --file src/utils.ts   --line 42

# Comment with line range
aide ado pr comment 123 "This block could be refactored"   --file src/utils.ts   --line 42   --end-line 50

# Read comment from stdin (for multiline)
echo "Long comment..." | aide ado pr comment 123 --stdin
```

## Implementation Notes

1. Add thread creation method to `AzureDevOpsClient`
2. For file comments, require `--file` and `--line`
3. Default to general PR comment if no file specified
4. Support reading from stdin for multiline comments
